subsc: Tertiary education,Secondary education,Primary education,Sub-national government administration,Central government administration

abstracts.cdata!:
On the whole the project is rated as
            satisfactory. The principals lessons drawn from the project
            are: a) Flexibility during implementation is critical in
            response to new and pressing developments in the education
            sector. b) Great weight should be given to assessing
            implementation capacity in the sector and the project should
            be kept simple and focused where implementation capacity is
            a concern. c) Successful institutional development
            initiatives require sustained assistance in the course of
            successive projects. d) Implementation of this project
            underscores the need to have a full complement of
            implementation staff in place before a project is launched.
            The Project Implementation Unit did not have technical staff
            with the requisite qualification when the project was
            initiated. This resulted in delaying project start-up by
            more than a year, which in turn resulted in the need to
            extend the closing date by two years.
